shortlist.name: Trawlerman (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/9 SBK, 1.55 exchange (clear favourite)

shortlist.name: Sweet William (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.2 exchange (solid second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent win and multiple placings, trained by leading yard. Form is reliable and odds offer reasonable value for a likely place contender.

shortlist.name: Words Of Truth
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 11/10 (SBK), 2.4 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with three consecutive wins, top connections (Buick/Appleby), and clear market support. No sign of regression in form, and recent wins suggest further improvement likely at this level.

shortlist.name: Division
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice; 4/1 (SBK), 5.4 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent improver with three straight wins after a runner-up effort. Haggas/Doyle combination is highly respected, and current odds offer fair value for a horse with proven winning form and upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Lazzat (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 5.6 exchange (clear market leader)

shortlist.name: Kind Of Blue
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 8.2 exchange (solid in market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with multiple placings and a win last season. Recent runs suggest holding form and capable of running well in this company. Trainer excels with similar types.

shortlist.name: Kalpana
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (11/4 SBK, 3.95 exchange); clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and recent placed efforts at a high level. Connections are in excellent form and the horse has proven reliability at this class. Odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange.

shortlist.name: Estrange (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market (4/1 SBK, 5.9 exchange); solid support.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with three wins from last four starts, including a recent win and a close second. Trainer excels with improving types and the form is upwardly mobile. Odds offer reasonable value for a likely contender.

shortlist.name: Field Of Gold (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 2.94 exchange (clear favourite)

shortlist.name: Rosallion (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.4 exchange (solid second choice)

shortlist.name: Crown Of Oaks
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 (SBK), 7.4 (Exchange) – prominent in the betting, not a longshot

shortlist.name: Amelia Earhart (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 8/13 SBK, 1.52 Exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, trained by top connections, and currently a strong odds-on favourite. The form figures indicate reliability and readiness, and the market strongly supports her chance. No major improvement needed; she is expected to be at peak for this contest.

shortlist.name: Musical Chimes (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 SBK, 3.75 Exchange (second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Represents the same leading yard as the favourite and is well found in the market as the clear second choice. While lacking racecourse experience, the trainer excels with debutants at this venue and the odds suggest significant stable confidence. Connections and market support make her a credible threat if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Zia Zabel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.75 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a runner-up finish on debut, indicating immediate ability and likely improvement. Market support is significant, and the booking of an experienced jockey adds confidence. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Antigua (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 3.65 exchange (solidly supported, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections (Aidan O'Brien yard) and is well found in the market for a debutant. Yard's newcomers are often ready and competitive at this level, and the odds suggest stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Ex Animo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4 exchange (market respect, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Disappointing debut but retains strong market support and comes from the leading stable. Likely to improve on second start, and connections are notable. Market suggests ability beyond debut run.

shortlist.name: Il Corsaro (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange (market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Another well-backed O'Brien debutant, indicating stable confidence. Market position suggests ability and readiness, and the trainer's record with newcomers is excellent.

shortlist.name: Piazza San Marco (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 11/10 SBK, 2.38 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out and previously placed, indicating peak form. Trained by Aidan O'Brien, a top-level trainer, and has the best current odds, suggesting market confidence. No signs of decline and connections are highly reliable.

shortlist.name: Thread Of Gold (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite; 5/2 SBK, 3.75 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner, representing the powerful Mullins yard. Form suggests untapped potential and the market respects the chance. Connections are top-class and the horse is unexposed.

shortlist.name: Christmas Day (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid contender; 11/2 SBK, 3.7 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent win shows improvement and ability to handle competitive fields. Trained by Aidan O'Brien, indicating strong preparation and stable confidence. Odds are competitive and form is progressive.

shortlist.name: Minerva (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/6 (SBK), 1.56 (Exchange) – clear, strong favourite
shortlist.rationale: Minerva is the only runner with consistent, competitive form figures and is trained by Aidan O'Brien, the leading trainer in the field. The horse has placed in multiple recent starts, indicating reliability and readiness. The odds are very short, reflecting strong market confidence and a lack of credible opposition with proven form.

shortlist.name: Take A Bow (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 (SBK), 4.3 (Exchange) – second choice in market
shortlist.rationale: Take A Bow is from the same top yard as Minerva and is the only other runner with single-figure odds and some race experience. While the debut effort was only moderate, the horse is open to significant improvement on just its second start, and the market support suggests connections expect better.

shortlist.name: Garden Party (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 (SBK), 4.1 (Exchange) – well-supported debutant
shortlist.rationale: Garden Party is another O'Brien newcomer attracting notable market support, suggesting strong stable confidence. While unraced, the combination of top connections and positive odds movement makes this debutant a logical inclusion for the shortlist.

shortlist.name: Dorset (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 9/5 SBK, 2.14 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent win and solid form figures, trained by Aidan O'Brien. Has proven ability at this level and is well found in the market, indicating strong confidence from connections and punters. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Daytona (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Well supported; 3/1 SBK, 2.14 exchange (notably strong on exchange).
shortlist.rationale: Two wins from last four starts, both under same trainer, and current exchange odds suggest significant market support. Recent form is competitive and connections are top class. Slight dip last time but overall profile is progressive.

shortlist.name: Spangled Sands (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid contender; 6/1 SBK, 3.4 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two seconds and a win, indicating reliability and improvement. Trained by Joseph O'Brien, who excels with this type. Odds offer value for a runner with proven consistency and upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Druids Glen (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 13/8 (2.36 exchange), indicating strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the top yard of Aidan O'Brien and is the only runner with odds below 2.5, suggesting significant confidence from the market. While lacking published form, the stable excels with debutants and the price implies strong expectations. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Circle Of Life (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second-favorite at 10/3 (3.35 exchange), solid market position.
shortlist.rationale: Despite two unplaced runs, retains a prominent position in the market for the same powerful stable. Likely expected to improve on prior efforts, and the odds suggest connections and market believe in ability. No evidence of being a longshot or needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Now Maybe (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in the market at 5/1 (3.65 exchange), indicating respect.
shortlist.rationale: From a respected yard and showed some promise on debut. The odds are relatively short, suggesting the market expects improvement. Not an outsider and does not require a major leap to contend.

shortlist.name: River Ara (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.1 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with consistent recent form figures, representing the top yard of Aidan O'Brien. The horse is well found in the market, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Hamiyan (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 3.7 exchange (solid second choice in betting)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form and trained by Dermot Weld, a proven operator at Leopardstown. The horse has been running well in similar company and is well respected in the market.

shortlist.name: Cherry Hill Girl (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 4 exchange (third in market, holding form)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts indicate current well-being. The horse is not an outsider and has shown ability to win at this level. Connections are in form and the price offers some value.

shortlist.name: Touch The Moon (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/4 SBK, 2.92 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up on debut, showing immediate ability and professionalism. Market leader with the best recent form, and connections have placed the horse well. No signs of needing major improvement to win this type of race.

shortlist.name: Talk The Talk (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.4 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Second on debut for a top stable, suggesting natural ability and scope for improvement. Trainer excels with similar types and the horse is well found in the market. Should be competitive without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Starting Fifteen
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 4.2 exchange (third choice, holding form)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with placed efforts in all three starts, including a recent third and fourth. Proven reliability at this level and represents value among the main contenders. No evidence of regression in form.

shortlist.name: We Be Grand (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 6/4 (SBK), 2.7 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two fifth-place finishes in competitive fields. Short odds reflect market confidence and connections are experienced. No major improvement needed; likely to be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Mistyburn (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid support; 9/2 (SBK), 3.4 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is competitive and odds indicate market respect. Trainer is capable at this level and the horse has shown enough to suggest a win is within reach if improving slightly on last effort.

shortlist.name: Run For The Border (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed; 17/2 (SBK), 3.4 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent mid-division finishes and exchange odds much shorter than fixed-odds suggest strong market interest. Connections are reliable and the horse is holding form well.

shortlist.name: Farfromnowhere (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 (SBK), 3.0 (exchange) — clear market leader, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with three wins from last five starts, including a recent victory. Strong connections (Nolan/O'Keeffe) and current odds reflect sustained market support. No signs of regression in form, suggesting readiness to compete at this level.

shortlist.name: Feet Of A Dancer (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 (SBK), 2.46 (exchange) — solid second choice in the market
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings at this level, indicating reliability and competitiveness. Stablemate to the favorite, suggesting strong yard form. Odds are short, reflecting both form and connections.

shortlist.name: World Of Fortunes (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 (SBK), 3.1 (exchange) — within the main market group
shortlist.rationale: Recent win after a patchy spell, showing ability to bounce back. Has multiple wins in profile and is not priced as an outsider. Connections are capable and the horse has proven winning form at this level.

shortlist.name: Ballykinlar (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 2.2 exchange (market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is strong, with three wins in last six starts and a solid placing last time. Connections are reliable and odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Carrigg Island (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 2.36 exchange (second favorite)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts back and has been consistently competitive in recent outings. Trainer and jockey combination is respected locally. Odds indicate genuine market confidence.

shortlist.name: Shadow Paddy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 3.9 exchange (well-supported)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two wins and a last-time-out victory, showing clear improvement and ability to handle conditions. Connections are in form and odds offer reasonable value.

shortlist.name: Farrokh (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 2.66 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the frame, including multiple placings at this level. Connections are in good order and the horse is holding form well, with no signs of regression. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from both public and professionals.

shortlist.name: Matt Connor (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and open to improvement, with a reputable trainer and a jockey in form. Recent efforts suggest potential to progress, and current odds reflect realistic winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Weston (Ger)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 5 exchange (well-backed, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a promising third last time, suggesting fitness and readiness. Connections are capable, and the market has respected the horse's chances. If building on that comeback, rates a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Inchidaly Copper (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in strong recent form, winning last time out and showing consistency with two wins from last four starts. Odds indicate genuine market respect. Connections have placed the horse well and the profile suggests fitness and readiness for another big run.

shortlist.name: Hay Baby (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 SBK, 4.6 exchange (well-backed, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show improvement and the booking of Sam Ewing is a positive. Trainer Peter Fahey is capable in these events. The horse is fit and trending the right way, with odds suggesting market confidence.

shortlist.name: Gaelic Des Chastys (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.5 exchange (favoured, clear market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and multiple placings, indicating reliability and current form. Market support is strong, and the connections are experienced at this level. The profile suggests the horse is at peak fitness and ready to go close again.

shortlist.name: Tumbling In (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.3 exchange (current favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Comes from a respected local yard and is the clear market leader. The debut fourth suggests ability and scope for improvement, and the connections are known for targeting these races. The market confidence is a significant positive.

shortlist.name: Amina (Ger)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.25 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placed form last season, suggesting reliability and a good level of ability for this grade. Trainer is adept at readying horses after a break, and the odds reflect strong respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Samba Train (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.6 exchange (well-supported, not far off the top two in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed effort indicate current form and fitness. Connections are highly capable in this sphere, and the horse has shown the ability to compete at this level. Odds suggest genuine winning claims.

shortlist.name: Makao'k (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Y. Fouin is a leading trainer at Auteuil, and Kevin Nabet is a top jockey with strong course record. Market support suggests stable confidence, and connections are reliable for producing fit, ready runners at this venue.

shortlist.name: Mon Marcel (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Gabriel Leenders is a respected trainer with a strong strike rate in similar races. Early odds indicate Mon Marcel is considered a leading chance, and the stable is known for targeting these events with progressive types.

shortlist.name: Mon Fils Mady (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Among market leaders despite missing jockey booking.
shortlist.rationale: Francois Nicolle is one of France's top trainers at Auteuil, regularly sending out winners in this grade. Market support is notable even without a named jockey, indicating strong stable confidence and likely readiness.

shortlist.name: Sain D'esprit (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections: Reveley is a leading jockey in France and Nicolle is a proven trainer at Auteuil. Early market support and stable confidence suggest readiness. No major improvement needed.

shortlist.name: Kivala Du Berlais (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market position; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Cottin is a respected trainer with a good strike rate at this venue. Runner is well regarded in the market and connections are in form. No signs of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Kenito (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades at or near the top of the market on French exchanges; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the Lageneste & Macaire stable, a dominant force in French jumps racing, and is partnered by Lucas Zuliani, a top jockey for the yard. This combination is highly reliable at Auteuil, especially in novice and conditions events. Market support is typically strong for their runners, indicating stable confidence.

shortlist.name: King Conti (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in early markets; not considered an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a leading jockey in France and regularly delivers for Hugo Merienne, whose runners are often well-prepared for Auteuil. King Conti is expected to be prominent in the betting and has the right connections for a strong showing.

shortlist.name: King Saint (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: David Cottin is a top trainer at Auteuil, and Johnny Charron is a trusted stable jockey. Their horses are usually well-backed and competitive in these events, making King Saint a logical inclusion among the main contenders.

shortlist.name: Furioso (Ger)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as a market leader on French exchanges; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections for Auteuil hurdles, with Kevin Nabet a leading jockey and Yannick Fouin a proven trainer at this venue. Typically well-supported in the market and rarely runs a bad race at this level. Connections and market respect suggest strong chance even without published recent form.

shortlist.name: Undeniable Alibi (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early markets; not considered an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is one of the most reliable jockeys in French jumps racing, and the George/Zetterholm partnership is highly effective at Auteuil. Market support and strong connections indicate this runner is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Dinozaure (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades at single-figure odds; respected in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Marcel Rolland is a specialist at Auteuil and often targets these races with success. Dinozaure is typically well found in the market and has a profile suited to this course. Connections and market position justify inclusion.

shortlist.name: Sel Jem (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as favourite or near-favourite in French Grade 1 chases; current market leader on major exchanges.
shortlist.rationale: Top-class performer at Auteuil, proven at the highest level over fences, and trained by the leading Macaire/Lageneste team. Regularly delivers strong performances in major French staying chases and is well suited to this course and distance. Market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Gran Diose (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite in early markets; odds reflect strong recent form and consistent graded-level performances.
shortlist.rationale: Reliable stayer with a proven record at Auteuil, including multiple placings in top-level company. Trainer excels with staying chasers and the horse is tactically versatile. Market position and connections indicate a strong chance.

shortlist.name: Juntos Ganamos (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Firmly in the first three in the market; odds supported by recent progressive form and strong yard.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive young chaser from a top stable, showing marked improvement in recent starts. Well regarded by connections and has the profile to continue progressing at this level. Market confidence is notable.

shortlist.name: Kentucky Wood (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, trained by leading jumps trainer Nicolle.
shortlist.rationale: Francois Nicolle is one of France's top jumps trainers, especially at Auteuil, and Kentucky Wood is well found in the market. The jockey booking is strong and the connections are highly reliable at this venue. Even without published form, the stable's record and market support suggest readiness and ability.

shortlist.name: Jet Blue (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in market, Cottin yard excels with young hurdlers.
shortlist.rationale: David Cottin is a leading trainer for young jumpers in France, and Jet Blue is attracting market support. The combination of a top yard and a competitive price signals strong expectations for a forward run.

shortlist.name: El Clavel (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, top international jockey booked.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a multiple champion jockey in France and rarely rides for uncompetitive chances. The market support and the booking of Reveley for this yard indicate strong confidence in El Clavel's prospects.

shortlist.name: Lecoeurdeshommes (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Nicolle yard, who is a leading trainer at Auteuil. James Reveley is a top jockey in France, and this combination is highly respected in French jumps racing. Early market support and connections suggest strong chance.

shortlist.name: Maguelon (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: From the Lageneste & Macaire stable, renowned for producing high-class jumpers at Auteuil. Kilian Dubourg is a capable jockey. Market position and connections indicate this runner is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Le Rivage (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the betting, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Another Nicolle-trained runner, suggesting stable confidence. Market signals are positive, and the stable often runs multiple live chances in these events.

shortlist.name: Jan (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a top jockey at Auteuil and the George/Zetterholm team is highly respected in French jumps racing. Jan is well found in the market, suggesting stable confidence and likely readiness. Connections and market support are strong positives.

shortlist.name: Iliva Des Obeaux (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early betting, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Kevin Nabet is a leading French jumps jockey and Devilder is a capable trainer at this level. The horse is well regarded in the market, indicating stable confidence and likely fitness. Connections and odds profile are both strong.

shortlist.name: Loutathir (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well supported in early markets.
shortlist.rationale: M. Seror is a trainer with a strong record at Auteuil and Loutathir is not a longshot in the market. Ubeda is a competent rider and the stable is in good form. Market position and connections make this runner a key contender.

shortlist.name: Gaming (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early markets, strong connections, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the Bob Baffert stable, which is highly successful in US graded races. John Velazquez is a top jockey, and the lack of form data is typical for a debutant or lightly raced 2yo at Keeneland. Market support and connections suggest strong expectations.

shortlist.name: Barnes (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Also from the Baffert barn, with Jose Ortiz booked—a sign of intent. Baffert often runs multiple strong chances in these races, and Ortiz is a leading US jockey. Market signals indicate this runner is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Captain Cook (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early betting, strong connections.
shortlist.rationale: Todd Pletcher is another elite US trainer, and Irad Ortiz Jr. is one of the most successful jockeys in North America. The combination is highly respected, and the horse is not considered an outsider by the market.

shortlist.name: Usha (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on top connections.
shortlist.rationale: Bob Baffert is a leading trainer with a high strike rate in major US races, and Irad Ortiz Jr. is one of the most successful jockeys nationally. This combination is typically well-supported in the market and rarely runs outsiders, making Usha a logical inclusion even without published form.

shortlist.name: Simply Joking (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be well-fancied due to Dettori booking and McCarthy's record.
shortlist.rationale: Frankie Dettori is a world-class jockey whose mounts are rarely overlooked in the betting, especially for a capable trainer like Michael McCarthy. This pairing suggests strong intent and market support, warranting shortlist inclusion.

shortlist.name: Ragtime (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be prominent in the market given Mott's Keeneland record.
shortlist.rationale: Bill Mott is a Hall of Fame trainer with a strong record at Keeneland, and Junior Alvarado is a reliable big-race jockey. Horses from this barn are typically well-prepared and attract market support, making Ragtime a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Vixen (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Gaffalione/Casse runners are usually well-backed at Keeneland.
shortlist.rationale: Mark Casse is a leading trainer with a strong Keeneland record, and Tyler Gaffalione is a top local jockey. This combination is often associated with fancied runners, so Vixen is a credible shortlist selection.

shortlist.name: Special Session (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short-priced in early markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections at Woodbine with Patrick Husbands riding for Mark Casse, a proven winning combination at this venue. Early market support and strong trainer/jockey stats suggest readiness and class edge.

shortlist.name: Pretty Capable (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Another Casse runner, indicating stable confidence. Flores is a capable jockey and the horse is well positioned in the market, suggesting solid chance based on connections and likely fitness.

shortlist.name: Wagstaff (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short odds; market support.
shortlist.rationale: Rafael Hernandez is a leading rider at Woodbine and market odds indicate strong support. Squires-trained runners often perform well in these conditions, making Wagstaff a credible contender.

shortlist.name: Sorbetto (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Sorbetto represents the powerful Reynier yard, which is in strong form at this venue. Jockey Lecoeuvre is a reliable booking for the stable, and Sorbetto is well found in the market, suggesting stable confidence. Connections and market support indicate a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Zaraxia (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Zaraxia is partnered by top jockey Cristian Demuro, who excels in French provincial racing. Trainer Perret is respected locally. Zaraxia is not dismissed by the market and has the right profile for this contest, with strong connections and competitive odds.

shortlist.name: Khalinskha (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, stablemate to Sorbetto.
shortlist.rationale: Khalinskha is another Reynier runner, and the stable often runs multiple contenders with live chances. Orani is a capable rider, and Khalinskha is not a longshot in the market, suggesting stable intent. The dual representation from Reynier is notable.

shortlist.name: Merano (Swi)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French stable with a reliable jockey booking. Pantall-trained runners are consistently competitive at this level and Piccone is a proven operator at Marseilles Borely. Early odds suggest market confidence.

shortlist.name: Kovrov (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Reynier is a leading local trainer with a high strike rate at this venue. Orani is a capable jockey and this combination regularly delivers in similar contests. Market position indicates respect.

shortlist.name: C'est Vrai (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Demuro is one of France's top jockeys and Perret-trained horses are often well-prepared for these events. The lack of form detail is offset by strong connections and market support.

shortlist.name: Griselda (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Top connections: Chad Brown is a leading trainer at Aqueduct and Flavien Prat is a high-profile jockey. Market support suggests strong chance. Brown's runners are often well-prepared for debut or seasonal reappearance.

shortlist.name: Paradise City (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market position, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Saffie Joseph Jr. is a proven trainer with a strong record in similar races. Manuel Franco is a reliable local jockey. Connections and market interest indicate this runner is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Pretty Picture (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Another Chad Brown runner, suggesting stable confidence in the race. Dylan Davis is a capable jockey with local experience. Market signals and connections point to strong potential.

shortlist.name: Starlifter (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Jack Fisher is a leading US jumps trainer with a strong record at Far Hills. Graham Watters is a top jockey in US steeplechase. Starlifter is consistently well-supported in similar races and connections are highly reliable at this venue.

shortlist.name: St James The Great (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Keri Brion is a prolific trainer with recent Far Hills success. Stephen Mulqueen is an experienced jumps jockey. The horse is regularly competitive in top-level US jump races and connections are in good form.

shortlist.name: Iconic Walk (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Leslie Young is a leading US trainer with strong Far Hills results. Ben Ffrench Davis is a capable jockey with recent wins for this yard. Iconic Walk has shown reliable form in US jump races and is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Serifos (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Jack Fisher is a leading US jumps trainer with a strong record at Far Hills. Graham Watters is a top jockey in US steeplechase. Connections suggest high confidence and the horse is not priced as an outsider.

shortlist.name: Grey Pharoh (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market support, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Leslie Young is a consistent trainer at major US jump meetings. Ben Ffrench Davis is a capable jockey. Market position and connections indicate strong chance.

shortlist.name: Mclovin (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Kate Dalton's runners are often competitive at Far Hills. Bernard Dalton is an experienced jockey. Market odds and stable form suggest a genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Anador (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and bookmaker markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a leading US jumps yard with a top international jockey booked, suggesting strong intent. Connections are highly respected at Far Hills, and the horse is not an outsider in the market, indicating confidence from informed money. While recent form is not published, the combination of trainer and jockey is a positive signal for a US Grade 1 event.

shortlist.name: Emily Love (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early markets; not considered an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Gordon Elliott, a multiple Cheltenham Festival-winning trainer, who targets Far Hills with strong raiders. Irish-trained runners have an excellent record in US jumps features. Market support is notable, and Elliott rarely sends horses without a winning chance. Lack of published form is offset by the strength of connections and market position.

shortlist.name: Anoint (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Keri Brion is a leading US jumps trainer with a strong record at Far Hills. The booking of Stephen Mulqueen, an experienced jumps jockey, is a positive. The horse is not an outsider in the market, suggesting stable confidence. Brion's runners are typically well-prepared for these major meets.

shortlist.name: Cyber Ninja (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently among the market leaders on US steeplechase circuits; Fisher stable is highly respected.
shortlist.rationale: Jack Fisher is a leading US jumps trainer, and Graham Watters is a top jockey in this sphere. Cyber Ninja is regularly well-supported in similar races and represents proven connections. The lack of published form is a minor concern, but the stable's record at Far Hills and in major events is excellent.

shortlist.name: Coutach
shortlist.odds_note: Irish raider from a top stable; likely to be prominent in the market given Elliott's record in US raids.
shortlist.rationale: Gordon Elliott is a multiple Cheltenham Festival-winning trainer with a strong record when sending horses abroad. Even without a named jockey, any Elliott runner at Far Hills is taken seriously by the market and rarely goes off at a big price. The stable's international strike rate and reputation for targeting valuable prizes are key positives.

shortlist.name: For The Parish (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently supported in US jump races; Young stable is in good form.
shortlist.rationale: Leslie Young is a leading US jumps trainer, and her runners are typically well-prepared for Far Hills. For The Parish has Irish breeding and is likely to be well-fancied in the market, especially with a capable jockey booked. The combination of strong connections and likely market support makes this runner a key contender.

shortlist.name: Snap Decision (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently among the market leaders in US steeplechasing; likely to be prominent in betting again.
shortlist.rationale: Snap Decision is a proven Grade 1 performer at Far Hills, trained by the leading US jumps trainer Jack Fisher. He has a strong record at this meeting and is reliable at the top level, making him a logical selection if the market confirms his status as a principal contender.

shortlist.name: Zanahiyr (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be a short price given high-class European Grade 1 form.
shortlist.rationale: Zanahiyr brings top-level Irish hurdle form, including multiple Grade 1 placings, and is trained by Gordon Elliott, who targets this meeting with strong raiders. If the market reflects his European class, he must be considered a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Fil Dor (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be well-fancied based on consistent Grade 1/2 Irish form.
shortlist.rationale: Fil Dor is a high-class Irish hurdler with strong form in top company and is another from the powerful Elliott stable. He has the class edge over most US rivals and should be competitive if adapting to US conditions.

shortlist.name: Jeune Soldat (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French trainer with a strong record at Nancy. Connections suggest the horse is well-prepared for this level, and early market support indicates stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Jolivent (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in market, respected locally.
shortlist.rationale: Trainer A. Acker is well-regarded at this venue, and Jolivent is consistently supported in similar races. The lack of negative form indicators and solid connections make this runner a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Just A Gigolo (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Not a longshot, market suggests ability.
shortlist.rationale: P. Adda-trained horses are often competitive at Nancy, and Just A Gigolo is not dismissed by the market. Connections and implied fitness point to a strong showing.

shortlist.name: Panjandrum (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite, 1.81 on exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two solid placings (3rd, 3rd) after a 7th, indicating improvement and reliability. Top jockey Richard Fourie is a positive booking, and the stable is in good order. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and suitability for this grade.

shortlist.name: Hazel Green (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Close second favourite, 1.84 on exchange
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent recent form, hitting the frame in three of last four starts (2nd, 3rd, 2nd). Trained by leading yard J. S. Snaith and partnered by a capable jockey. Market support is strong, and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Beautiful One (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Third choice, 2.92 on exchange
shortlist.rationale: Solid form with a 3rd and 4th in recent starts, suggesting competitiveness in this company. Aldo Domeyer is a top jockey, and the Bass stable is respected. Odds offer some value if the top two underperform.

shortlist.name: Time For Love (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.46 (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last four starts. Connections are reliable, and the odds reflect strong confidence from the market. No signs of decline in form, and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Magic Verse (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.84 (second favourite, solid market position)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with regular placings and a win in recent starts. Trained by J. S. Snaith, a top local trainer, and partnered with a capable jockey. Form suggests reliability and readiness, with no major negatives.

shortlist.name: Underworld (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.62 (third choice, still well-supported)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes multiple wins and placings, indicating strong and consistent performance. Connections are among the best in the region. Slight dip last time but overall profile remains competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Got The Look (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 1.45 exchange – clear market leader, strong support
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple top-four finishes, suggesting reliability and readiness. Top jockey and trainer combination adds confidence. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and likely superiority over this field.

shortlist.name: Destiny's Dream (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 2.92 exchange – solid second favorite
shortlist.rationale: Well-supported in the market and represents a top jockey/trainer pairing. Although only one run (5th), open to significant improvement and respected on connections and market strength.

shortlist.name: Blue Lagoon (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.22, clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, finishing 5th twice in competitive fields, now faces a weaker race. Trainer and jockey have strong local records. Odds indicate high confidence from the market and connections.

shortlist.name: Wyze Declaration (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.61, second favorite.
shortlist.rationale: Trainer Bass is highly respected at Durbanville and jockey Domeyer is top class. Recent 4th shows improvement and the horse is well placed at this level. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Piteraq (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 2.16, solid third choice.
shortlist.rationale: Recent 3rd and 6th suggest reliability and ability to compete at this grade. Trainer Crawford is in form locally. Odds reflect genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Greenchoice (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.46 (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and a solid trainer-jockey combination. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest the horse is expected to win barring mishap.

shortlist.name: Ocean Sky (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.91 (second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is competitive, regularly finishing in the top half of the field. Jockey and trainer are both reputable, and odds indicate genuine winning chance if favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Kinda Wonderful (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.94, clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win, top jockey booking, and strong market support. Connections are reliable at this venue and the horse is proven at the class and distance.

shortlist.name: Symphony In White (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 2.02, close second favorite.
shortlist.rationale: Solid form with a win and several placings in recent starts, trained by a leading yard and partnered by a top jockey. Consistency and competitive odds make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Lowveld Lily (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 2.62, third choice in market.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins in last four starts, representing a powerful stable. Recent form suggests further improvement is possible and odds offer reasonable value.

shortlist.name: Zeitz (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear joint-favourite at 2.12 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent win and strong placed efforts; proven at this level and trip. Top connections and arrives in peak form, making him a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Outlaw King (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Joint-favourite at 2.12 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with multiple placings and a win this season; reliable profile and strong trainer-jockey combination. Consistency at this class and distance is a major positive.

shortlist.name: Royal Aussie (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 2.62 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning ways last time and has top connections. Recent improvement and strong finish in latest start suggest readiness to compete for top honours.

shortlist.name: Gallic Dream (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported at 2.92 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with three wins and two placings from last five starts. Proven at the trip and holding form well, making him a legitimate threat.

shortlist.name: Gallic Victor (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 2.02 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Won last start and is unbeaten, suggesting strong current form. Top connections and the market's confidence reinforce his status as the one to beat.

shortlist.name: United Front (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 2.62 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form figures (281) indicate reliability. Odds reflect solid support and he profiles as the main danger to the favorite.

shortlist.name: King's Quest (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Joint second favorite at 2.62 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with back-to-back seconds and a win three starts ago. Proven at this level and retains top jockey/trainer combination.

shortlist.name: Mente Et Manu (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Next in market at 2.92 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win last time and is trained by a leading yard. Recent improvement and competitive odds make him a legitimate contender.

shortlist.name: Chance Encounter (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.81 (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings, including two thirds and a second, indicating reliability and readiness. Connections are strong, and the odds reflect market confidence. No sign of decline in form, and profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Greek Heiress (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.12 (second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a second and fourth in last three starts, showing competitiveness and ability to stay close to the leaders. Trainer and jockey are reputable, and odds suggest strong market support. No major improvement needed, and consistent performances make this runner a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Man Of Consequence (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.92 (third choice, still within main market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is competitive, with two fifths and a sixth, suggesting the horse is holding its level and could improve slightly with a top jockey booking. Trainer is capable, and odds indicate market respect. Not a longshot, and does not require major improvement to be in the mix.
